summary: Email chain between Ghislaine Maxwell's defense attorney Christian Everdell and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York regarding logistical issues delivering discovery materials (hard drives and disks) to Maxwell at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC). The emails discuss arrangements for hand-delivery of evidence, upcoming production deadlines, and a Touhy request.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Lead attorney corresponding with the U.S. Attorney's Office about delivering discovery materials to his client, Ghislaine Maxwell, at the MDC. He is coordinating hard drive deliveries and ensuring she receives evidence promptly.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The incarcerated defendant who is to receive discovery materials (hard drives and disks) at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC). Her attorneys are ensuring she gets the evidence.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Copied on the email chain as part of Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Copied on the email chain as part of Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team.

persons.name: Thomas J. Powers
persons.context: Copied on the email chain as part of Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team.

persons.name: Ms. Papapetru
persons.context: Mentioned as a contact at the MDC who should be notified before sending a disk to Ghislaine Maxwell to avoid it being returned.

connections.description: Everdell is actively working to ensure Maxwell receives discovery materials at the MDC, coordinating deliveries and following up on logistical issues.
Both are part of Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team, copied on the same emails discussing case logistics.

Everdell references her as a contact at the MDC to coordinate delivery of a disk to Maxwell.

events.title: Discovery Production
events.description: A production of discovery materials was made on this date, referenced in the context of loading a hard drive for Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Discovery Deadline
events.description: Deadline for the government to produce 3500 material, Giglio material, 404(b) notice and evidence, co-conspirator identities and statements, witness list, and exhibit list. Maxwell's defense expects to receive these materials on this date.

events.title: Touhy Request Submission
events.description: Maxwell's defense made a Touhy request (a request for testimony or documents from a federal employee) on this date. The email asks for an update on its status.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team was actively coordinating with the U.S. Attorney's Office to hand-deliver discovery hard drives to her at the MDC to avoid delays.
A disk containing discovery had been previously sent to Maxwell at the MDC but was inexplicably returned to the SDNY, requiring a new copy to be sent.
The defense anticipated a large volume of critical discovery materials (3500, Giglio, 404(b), co-conspirator info, witness and exhibit lists) due on October 11, 2021, close to the trial date.
The defense had made a Touhy request on August 30, 2021, and was seeking an update on its status from the prosecution.
The email chain shows logistical challenges in ensuring an incarcerated defendant receives voluminous electronic discovery in a timely manner.
